meanings.definition: A sudden attack or violent expression of a particular emotion or activity.
meanings.sent1: During the argument, he experienced a paroxysm of anger and slammed the door.
meanings.sent2: The paroxysm of laughter that followed the joke filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent3: The paroxysm of excitement over winning the game caused him to jump up and down.
meanings.sent4: Her paroxysm of fear at the sight of the spider was so intense, she froze in place.
meanings.sent5: The paroxysm of sadness that washed over her when she heard the news was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: A sudden recurrence or intensification of a symptom, such as a spasm or seizure.
meanings.sent1: After taking the medication, he experienced a paroxysm of pain in his leg.
meanings.sent2: The paroxysm of coughing kept him up all night.
meanings.sent3: The paroxysm of sneezing during the meeting was both embarrassing and disruptive.
meanings.sent4: Her paroxysm of hiccups seemed never-ending and drew attention from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The paroxysm of itching from the bug bite was unbearable and kept him scratching all day.
